dt: {bc}any of various extremely irregular curves or shapes for which any suitably chosen part is similar in shape to a given larger or smaller part when magnified or reduced to the same size

et: borrowed from French {it}fractal{/it} (adjective), {it}fractale{/it} (noun), from Latin {it}frāctus{/it} (past participle of {it}frangere{/it} "to break, shatter") + French {it}-al{/it} {et_link|-al:1|-al:1}, {it}-ale{/it} {et_link|-al:2|-al:2} {ma}{mat|break:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: any of various extremely irregular curves or shapes for which any suitably chosen part is similar in shape to a given larger or smaller part when magnified or reduced to the same size
